entry.title: Midnight Dynamite
entry.summary:
by vidrioborroso

First, you're helping Kris and Susie dry out Toriel's CRT after a heavy rainfall.

Next, you're buying a VHS and cassette tapes after a promise to look after the television they love enough to call ‘Tenna’.

And sometime after, upon bringing Tenna home and living up to your promise by watching movies and the news on him every so often, you come back from work to see a flustered TV-headed man the size of a small pet waiting at your feet, apologizing for what he's seen since you set him up in your bedroom.

It takes a while for ‘Tenna’ to convince you he's not spewing bullshit about who he is, but when you finally believe him, he's so overjoyed, a flower blooms from his nose and he grows tall enough to reach the ceiling and smash past it.

Logically, of course, you pass out.

entry.title: Angel's Requiem: Tales Untold. (Canon Side Stories to Angel's Requiem)
entry.summary:
by Angelholic17

Contains the canonical Side Stories of the main plot that occur during Angel's Requiem. Every side story chapter lists the main chapter it's connected to.
The current first side story occurs during CH27.

Angel's Requiem Summary:
The Angel has been drifting through worlds for as long as they can remember. Rarely acknowledged, and usually hated if they are. The Angel wants so desperately for a world to live in, a life of it's own that it didn't take from another.
So when the good doctor created that connection and promised a body of their own, and a world to live in, they jumped at the chance.
But when things went wrong and their hope stolen away, the Angel had to fix it themselves.
They would earn their own life with their own efforts.

After collecting every crystal, every egg, and the knowledge of how to get their body back, they go to finally meet with their desire.
But the friends they tried to make and the cage who took away their chance at freedom won't make it simple.
They can only hope that they will listen to their side of the story.

Good luck, ANGEL. You'll need it.

entry.title: Escaping the Stage
entry.summary:
by Toxicott

The Angel, the only one with real power in their world, was forced in an elaborate, yet incomplete, script of sorts, reciting and replaying their part over and over again. They could pick up the pen, they could fill in the missing pieces of the script, yet they lacked the eraser to delete and rewrite anew.
Noelle Holiday, having become aware of her situation after the first time it snowed. Merely an actor in the grand stage of their world, forced to play her part again and again. She had no control over her fate, as she lacked the pen to write.
The two come to a realisation, and a close partnership. They would not stop until the script was nothing more than dust, fluttering away in the snow.

entry.title: Crumbling Tower
entry.summary:
by anonymousyellowlizard

“Kris, go… Finish this.” Susie’s voice leaves no room for argument.

They seem reluctant. Their throat works against a lump, staring at Susie still, eyes a little wet.

“Go on, Kris,” Ralsei soothes. “I’ll stay with her.”

Kris inclines their head in a listless nod. When they walk away, the steps ring heavy.

Susie’s knees give out then, the effort too much, and she falls into a heap on the ground. Only Ralsei’s hold on her breaks the fall.

“You’re hurt,” Ralsei murmurs.

At the end of their adventures, there is only numbness and silence.
And a very injured Susie.
Ralsei holds the line and shines the light of hope for her.
